p: For diseased horses, three client-owned horses who were going to be euthanized (per the owner's request) due to moderate to severe neurological signs were donated to the CEH for this study. These horses were donated with presumed CVCM. These horses had a normal physical examination. The neurological examination revealed signs consistent with a symmetrical cervical (C1 to C6) myelopathy. Their neurological deficits were graded as 3 according to a published grading scale [ 31]. The protocol was approved by UC Davis Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) on 24 June 2015 (protocol no. 18801).
